title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Le Jasmin [Jasmine] from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Cultivation of Flowers Service]", 1821–24
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Le Jasmin [crossed out in graphite]
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: A family scene on a terrace surrounded by jasmine bushes. Parents observe the garden while a young girl, right foreground,  gathers jasmine sprays from the ground.  A boy, holding a jasmine blossom in his right hand, leans against a garden bench, left foreground.  A gardener, rear center, climbs the terrace stairs.  A garden structure in the Palladian style is in the left rearground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Le Jasmin [Jasmine] from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Cultivation of Flowers Service]", 1821–24.Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper. 1989-13-6.
